history.text: This sounds like a fun movie. Do you think you will like the character Officer Judy Hopps?
Hi! Have you seen Zootopia? Rotten Tomatoes gives it a score of 98%!
I haven't, have you?
No, I haven't seen the movie.
Judy Hopps is played by Ginnifer Goodwin, and I generally like her performances, so I could see myself liking that character.
What do you think of Idris Elba, who plays Chief Bogo. Do you think you would like that character?
He sounds a bit tough, but yeah.
Sounds like Officer Judy should be more than there for parking duty, as she was the academy valedictorian, huh?
I would think so! Valedictorians are used to working hard and being at the top!
I guess we all have to face stereotypes, though. Have you faced any?
I have, as a woman. Have you?
Yes. As a woman as well. Though I'd say the bigger one is people assuming I'm a cookie-cutter white girl. Most people don't realize that I know what it is like to scrimp by.
It looks like Judy had to open her mind to the stereotypes that Nick had faced as well.
I can understand that, been there. Yes, and they seem to be working together to solve the crime, think they will?
Yes, if only because not working together wouldn't be very feel good. They could still make a movie about it, but I doubt it would be profitable.
I think they will get it worked out in this one. Maybe she will solve it in the 10 hours she has left before she's fired, do you think?
Oh, yeah, you betcha!
How do you think Jenny Slate, the mayor will affect the ending?
Will there be a twist in the plot?
Maybe, I think Manchas will be found. Don't you?
Naturally! No one wants to see the criminal get away. Or, they at least want to see him have his day in court.
Exactly! Being able to see the traffic camera sure helped Judy, she found him. I bet he was scared at the Cliffside Asylum, can you imagine?
Not hardly!
So, who is this Otterton? The one Manchas is talking about?
I'm not sure, but he seems to be a big part.
Do you think the mayor, Lionheart, is introduced earlier in the film, or just sprung onto the audience like a criminal in a classic detective story?
They seemed to drop him in, as the evil guy, since they arrest him.
Hmm, true. That must be why the sheep was introduced earlier, to have someone ready to step up and take charge!
Judy quit her job, but I guess she had to help when she learned about the night howlers actually being toxic flowers that cause mammals to act crazy. Did you expect that?
I definitely did not see that coming!
What do you suspect was the true cause of the animals going crazy?
Then the new Bellwether ends up being a bad guy! plot twist?
Plot twist indeed!
I believe they were being drugged by the toxic flowers, you think?
But who planted the flowers...
Or does this just introduced a plot device for Zootopia 2?
I know, maybe Bellwether?
I bet that will be in the next movie, like you said.
It was fun, thanks!

uid1response.feedback: I may watch as a family movie, sounds cute!
